categories.body: Minor graphic novel characters (Legend of Korra)

paragraphs.body: Wenyan is the campaign manager for ${link_0} ${link_1}'s reelection campaign in 174 ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: Wenyan is the campaign manager for President Raiko's reelection campaign in 174 AG.

paragraphs.body: Concerned with President Raiko's bad image with the people of ${link_0}, Wenyan ordered several campaign posters that depicted a heroic Raiko punching ${link_1}'s enormous ${link_2} while sporting the slogan "Vote Raiko—He'll wallop tyranny with a knockout blow!" To convince a skeptical Raiko, who was concerned that the poster sent the misleading message that he was the one defeating Kuvira rather than the ${link_3}, Wenyan pointed out that Raiko needed to project an image of strength and fearlessness to offset the people's belief that their president was a coward who abandoned them in their time of need.
paragraphs.text: Concerned with President Raiko's bad image with the people of Republic City, Wenyan ordered several campaign posters that depicted a heroic Raiko punching Kuvira's enormous mecha suit while sporting the slogan "Vote Raiko—He'll wallop tyranny with a knockout blow!" To convince a skeptical Raiko, who was concerned that the poster sent the misleading message that he was the one defeating Kuvira rather than the Avatar, Wenyan pointed out that Raiko needed to project an image of strength and fearlessness to offset the people's belief that their president was a coward who abandoned them in their time of need.

paragraphs.body: Their conversation was interrupted by Avatar ${link_0}, ${link_1}, and ${link_2}, who came to discuss the poor housing accommodations of the people left homeless after the ${link_3}. When Raiko refused to fund their project, reasoning that the city had no additional money to spare, Wenyan took the president aside and pointed out that the three women might have been on to something. With Raiko's approving rate at a negative three percent despite running unopposed, he reasoned that, if the president managed to give all the refugees a home again, the people's hate for him would shift to appreciation, which would translate in them voting for him for a second term in office. Wenyan's theory resonated with Raiko, and the president gave the green light for the housing project.

links.body: invasion of the United Republic of Nations

paragraphs.text: Their conversation was interrupted by Avatar Korra, Asami Sato, and Zhu Li, who came to discuss the poor housing accommodations of the people left homeless after the invasion of the United Republic of Nations. When Raiko refused to fund their project, reasoning that the city had no additional money to spare, Wenyan took the president aside and pointed out that the three women might have been on to something. With Raiko's approving rate at a negative three percent despite running unopposed, he reasoned that, if the president managed to give all the refugees a home again, the people's hate for him would shift to appreciation, which would translate in them voting for him for a second term in office. Wenyan's theory resonated with Raiko, and the president gave the green light for the housing project.

paragraphs.body: Wenyan and ${link_0} usurped ${link_1} and ${link_2}'s housing project as their own to gain votes from the homeless evacuees.
paragraphs.text: Wenyan and Raiko usurped Asami and Zhu Li's housing project as their own to gain votes from the homeless evacuees.

paragraphs.body: In order to further improve Raiko's approval ratings, Wenyan and Raiko visited Asami and Zhu Li's construction site with a group of refugees, usurping Asami and Zhu Li's housing project to serve their own political agenda. When the evacuees asked when the construction would be completed, Wenyan took over from Raiko to promise the crowd that they would be able to enjoy a life of safety and security at the "Raiko Residencies" by the end of the month. He deflected the attention away from Asami and Zhu Li, who desired to have a conversation with the president, by inviting the press to take a picture of them all. Since the two women continued to confront Raiko about his usurpation of their housing project, Wenyan led the president away while thanking the crowd for their attendance and reminding them that "a vote for Raiko [was] a vote for the future."
paragraphs.text: In order to further improve Raiko's approval ratings, Wenyan and Raiko visited Asami and Zhu Li's construction site with a group of refugees, usurping Asami and Zhu Li's housing project to serve their own political agenda. When the evacuees asked when the construction would be completed, Wenyan took over from Raiko to promise the crowd that they would be able to enjoy a life of safety and security at the "Raiko Residencies" by the end of the month. He deflected the attention away from Asami and Zhu Li, who desired to have a conversation with the president, by inviting the press to take a picture of them all. Since the two women continued to confront Raiko about his usurpation of their housing project, Wenyan led the president away while thanking the crowd for their attendance and reminding them that "a vote for Raiko [was] a vote for the future."

paragraphs.body: When Korra and ${link_0} arrived on ${link_1} before they could leave the construction site, asking for an audience, Wenyan told the president that he would deal with the Avatar. Approaching her, he told Korra that Raiko was extremely busy and that, if she desired to speak with him, she needed to make an appointment with him like everyone else. Before he could truly finish his sentence, however, Korra shut him up by ${link_2} a metal slap over his mouth and left him to struggle to remove it.
paragraphs.text: When Korra and Tenzin arrived on Oogi before they could leave the construction site, asking for an audience, Wenyan told the president that he would deal with the Avatar. Approaching her, he told Korra that Raiko was extremely busy and that, if she desired to speak with him, she needed to make an appointment with him like everyone else. Before he could truly finish his sentence, however, Korra shut him up by bending a metal slap over his mouth and left him to struggle to remove it.
